alert.note: Alert for Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Eastern Magic Valley; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Shoshone, Lava Beds (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 5:01PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms over INL and south of Magic City moving southeast toward Aberdeen, American Falls Reservoir, and Shoshone through 530 PM MDT... At 458 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Taber to 16 miles west of Springfield to 14 miles northwest of Minidoka to 16 miles north of Gooding, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Brief moderate rain, wind gusts to 40 mph, and occasional lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects as well as hazardous boating conditions across American Falls Reservoir and Lake Walcott. Locations impacted include... Blackfoot, Shoshone, western American Falls Reservoir, Aberdeen, Richfield, Minidoka, Atomic City, Rose, Fort Hall Eagle Lodge, Taber, Springfield, Rockford, Moreland, Pingree, Fort Hall Lincoln Creek Lodge, Groveland, Dietrich, Sterling, Bear Trap Airport and Kimama. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near American Falls Reservoir or Lake Walcott, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Eastern Magic Valley; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Shoshone, Lava Beds
